Welcome to LLMSQL Project

LLMSQL is a Python package for SQL reasoning with LLMs and vLLM inference.

üí° Description

LLMSQL Benchmark is an open-source framework providing a modernized, cleaned, and extended version of the original WikiSQL dataset, specifically designed for evaluating and fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) on Text-to-SQL tasks.

LLMSQL addresses key shortcomings of WikiSQL by ensuring reproducibility and an LLM-ready format with over 80,000 cleaned question-SQL pairs.

Key improvements over WikiSQL

  • Data Cleaning: Systematically corrected errors (like type mismatches and case sensitivity issues) that previously caused over 41% of questions to return empty results.
  • LLM-Ready Format: Transitioned to human-readable, standard SQL instead of non-intuitive numerical placeholders, significantly improving model training and evaluation.

üìö Documentation

Note: The extended documentation pages (e.g., installation guide, API reference) are currently under construction and will be available soon. Please refer to the Quick Start section below.

‚ö° Quick Start

Installation

pip3 install llmsql

Recommended Workflow (vLLM)

We recommend using the dedicated command-line tool for the quickest inference and evaluation with vLLM acceleration:

pip install llmsql[vllm]
llmsql evaluate --model gpt-4 --dataset llmsql_dev

Evaluation API (Python)

For custom integration and fine-tuning workflows, use the evaluator class directly:

from llmsql import LLMSQLEvaluator

evaluator = LLMSQLEvaluator(workdir_path="llmsql_workdir")
report = evaluator.evaluate(outputs_path="path_to_your_outputs.jsonl")
print(report)
